subject: Fashion
title: Cashmere and Its True Cost
description: A 60-second lesson on Cashmere and Its True Cost.

hook.text: A cashmere goat produces only 150 grams of usable fiber per year.

buildup.text: One sweater needs the annual output of three to five goats.

discovery.text: Cashmere is softer and warmer per gram than sheep's wool.

twist.text: Booming demand caused overgrazing in Mongolia, turning grasslands to desert.

climax.text: Cheap cashmere flooded markets, but quality dropped dramatically.

punchline.text: Real luxury is rare. Mass cashmere forgot that.

quiz.question: Why did cashmere demand cause environmental damage?
options: Overgrazing turned Mongolian grasslands to desert
